newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Village Roadshow forms jv with Sega.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Village Roadshow forms jv with Sega.

text.p: Entertainment and leisure group Village Roadshow Ltd said on Monday it had signed a joint venture agreement with Japanese computer game firm Sega Enterprises Ltd to distribute Sega's coin-operated games throughout Australia and New Zealand.
The joint venture would be managed by Village Roadshow's Village Nine Leisure (VNL) unit and would begin with the launch of Sega's new Virtua Fighter 3 video game, Village said.

"The joint venture represents a significant value-added move for VNL's Intencity Indoor Theme Park business and represents a shift in direction for Sega, which, up to now, has dealt with individual distributors in Australia on a product by product basis," Village Roadshow said.
"Sega will now be able to participate directly in supply and service in the Australian and New Zealand market," it said.

"We see the JV with Sega as a long term strategic alliance of key importance for VNL in its bid to become the market leader in out-of-home entertainment," Village chairman Robert Kirby said in a statement.
"Further, the experience gained with the joint venture will facilitate our international expansion plans," he said.
Sega Enterprises chief executive Hayao Nakayama said Village was a logical and strategic partner in Australia and New Zealand.
"This is a partnership which will lead to the overall expansion of the market and growth in the entertainment sector," Nakayama said.
